result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver THC (<=200 grams)

records.addlTxt:
Judge John Manydeeds for Branch 1 intake. 
(Cases 22CF613, 22CF736, 22CF919 are called at 9:50 AM) Defendant Cesar Cruz-Ramirez in court.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Cesar Cruz-Ramirez.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a Preliminary Hearing and Court accepts waiver in 22CF613, 22CF736, 22CF919. 
Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.

Defendant Cesar Cruz-Ramirez in court with Attorney Katherine Cook.  Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.

Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(11:23 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Cesar Cruz-Ramirez appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Cesar Cruz-Ramirez.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on June 27, 2022 at 2:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
